holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day
holidays.description: A lively celebration of Irish culture marked by parades, green attire, and festive foods and drinks.
holidays.origin: Commemorates St. Patrick, the patron saint of Ireland, who is credited with bringing Christianity to the Irish people.
holidays.funFact: Originally, St. Patrick's Day was a solemn religious occasion until it evolved into the boisterous celebrations known today, complete with green beer and shamrocks!

holidays.name: Submarine Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the invention and service of submarines and their crews.
holidays.origin: Marks the anniversary of the first successful military use of a submarine, the USS Holland, in 1900.
holidays.emoji: ÔøΩ submarines aren‚Äôt often celebrated, but they‚Äôve changed naval warfare forever!
holidays.funFact: The first military submarine was nicknamed 'The Fenian Ram' and was designed to attack enemy ships stealthily underwater.

holidays.name: Everything You Think Is Wrong Day
holidays.description: A humorous day dedicated to challenging our assumptions and opening our minds to new perspectives.
holidays.origin: Started as a quirky internet holiday encouraging people to question their biases and beliefs.
holidays.funFact: On this day, it's perfectly acceptable ‚Äì even encouraged ‚Äì to admit when you're wrong about something trivial, like pineapple on pizza!

holidays.name: Corned Beef and Cabbage Day
holidays.description: A tasty tribute to the classic Irish-American dish enjoyed especially on St. Patrick's Day.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the traditional meal often served in the U.S. to honor Irish heritage on March 17.
holidays.funFact: Corned beef and cabbage became popular among Irish immigrants in America, even though it's not as traditional in Ireland itself!
